result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe E Haynes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joe E Haynes appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Joe E Haynes.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Motion Hearing.
Attorney Fuentes informed the Court he is in Jury Trial in Branch 41 and requests an adjournment. Court grants request.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Evidentiary hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Joe E Haynes appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Joe E Haynes.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has filed a motion and the State will be responding orally. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.

Defendant Joe E Haynes in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joe E Haynes appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense requests motion date. State requests status date. Briefing schedule set.  Case adjourned to Br 30 for status.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joe E Haynes in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery but is awaiting an offer and requests an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joe E Haynes in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Joe E Haynes in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
